abstract.p: Scholastic Inc, children's educational publishing company, says it will make content from its Scholastic.com Web site available to students and teachers who use Palm wireless hand-held organizers; Web site features daily news service, lesson planners and educational events (S)

block.p: Scholastic Inc., the children's educational publishing company, said it would make content from its scholastic .com Web site available to students and teachers who use Palm wireless hand-held organizers. Scholastic.com features a daily news service, lesson planners and educational events. Mike Lorion, vice president for education at Palm, said the company could not say how many teachers or students currently used Palm hand-held devices, but he said students made up a large percentage of buyers of Palm's lower-priced m100 unit.
